title: Graham Idle
text:
Graham Idle (10 March 1950) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s. He played at club level for <a href="Bramley%20RLFC">Bramley</a>, <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 812</a>), <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a>, <a href="Hunslet%20R.L.F.C.">Hunslet</a>, <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a>, <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a>, <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a>, <a href="Mansfield%20Marksman">Nottingham City</a> and <a href="Liverpool%20Stanley%23Highfield%20%E2%80%93%201991%E2%80%931996">Highfield</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 11 or 12, or 13, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Graham Idle's birth was registered in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> district, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
Idle made a total of 740 appearances during his career between 1969 and 1993 – the fifth highest total in British rugby league history.
Championship appearances.
Graham Idle played in <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a>'s victory in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> during the <a href="1980%E2%80%9381%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1980–81 season</a>.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Graham Idle played in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 3-12 defeat by <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> in the <a href="1979%20Challenge%20Cup%20%28rugby%29">1979</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1978%E2%80%9379%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1978–79 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 5 May 1979, in front of a crowd of a crowd of 94,218.
County Cup Final appearances.
Graham Idle played right-, i.e. number 12, in <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a>'s 5-10 defeat by <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a> in the <a href="1981%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1981</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1981%E2%80%9382%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1981–82 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 3 October 1981, and played left-, i.e. number 11, in the 7-18 defeat by <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="1982%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1982</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1981%E2%80%9382%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1981–82 season</a> at <a href="Elland%20Road">Elland Road</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 2 October 1982.
BBC2 Floodlit Trophy Final appearances.
Graham Idle played right-, i.e. number 12, in <a href="Bramley%20RLFC">Bramley</a>'s 15-7 victory over <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> in the <a href="1973%20BBC2%20Floodlit%20Trophy">1973</a> <a href="BBC2%20Floodlit%20Trophy">BBC2 Floodlit Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1973%E2%80%9374%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1973-74 season</a> at <a href="Halton%20Stadium">Naughton Park</a>, <a href="Widnes">Widnes</a> on Tuesday 18 December 1973.
